data.title: Canberra Mega Pass
data.meta_description: VisitCanberra has everything you need to plan your perfect Canberra getaway, from accommodation and attractions, to events and eating hotspots.
data.text:
Enjoy three iconic Canberran experiences and save

Tour Australia’s premier elite sports precinct with an Olympian at the Australian Institute of Sport, encounter the animal kingdom up close and personal at the National Zoo & Aquarium, and unpack your curiosities at Questacon – The National Science and Technology Centre.

Australian Institute of Sport:

Tour times: 10am, 11:30am, 1pm and 2:30pm

Duration: 90 minutes

Opening hours: Mon - Fri 8am - 5pm Weekends 9:30am - 4pm Closed Christmas Day, Boxing Day, New Years Day and Good Friday

The National Zoo and Aquarium:

Opening hours: Daily 9:30am - 5pm Closed Christmas Day

Questacon:

Opening hours: Daily 9am - 5pm Closed Christmas Day

Admission Charge:

Adult $89.10 Child (4-17 years) $56.70 Senior/Student $74.25 Family (2 Adults and up to 3 children) $253.80 Child (under 3 years) Free

Tickets can also be purchased at the Canberra and Region Visitor Centre.

Inclusions

Tours & Activities

1

Australian Institute of Sport

Leverrier Street, BRUCE,2617,ACT, Australia

Find out what it takes to become an elite athlete with a behind-the-scenes tour of the AIS.

You are invited to experience our world-class sporting precinct led by an elite athlete.

You may see our gymnasts in training or some of Australia's top swimmers doing their laps.

During the tour, take on the sporting challenges in Sportex - an interactive sports experience where you can test your skills at virtual football, cycling, rowing, wheelchair basketball and rock climbing.

2

Questacon

King Edward Terrace, PARKES, 2600, ACT, Australia

Channel your inner geek at Questacon, where there’s no shortage of weird and wonderful spaces to get curious, discover and play! Experiment, invent and innovate and you'll uncover the smarter way to have fun. Young scientists will enjoy Mini Q as they play and learn in a gallery specifically designed for 0-6 year olds. Explore the world of Artificial Intelligence, test gravity by falling down a six metre tall slide, experience the power and beauty of our awesome Earth and no visit to Questacon is complete without watching one of the Spectacular Science Shows. With over 200 engaging and interactive exhibits to explore, Questacon will inspire you to learn more.

3

National Zoo and Aquarium

Lady Denman Drive, YARRALUMLA, ACT 2611, Australia

The National Zoo & Aquarium is Australia's only COMBINED zoo and aquarium, and Australia's largest inland aquarium.

With a wide variety of both native and exotic animals, as well as the largest inland saltwater tank in Australia, there is something for everyone. See an impressive range of animals, including the largest collection of Big Cats anywhere in Australia, including Lions, Tigers, Cheetahs, Cougars, Snow Leopards and our recent arrivals - Magnificent White Lions! 8 of them!

The animals are housed in some of the largest enclosures for traditional city zoos. Wander in and have a casual stroll around the park, or make a day of it with family, friends and our complimentary BBQ's.

Tickets valid for 12 months from date of purchase.

Please contact each attraction before you visit to confirm availability and confirm a date and time to visit. At peak times, all attractions will be busy and to avoid disappointment prior confirmation of your visit is essential to ensure entry.

The purchase of a Canberra Mega Pass cannot be used towards the purchase of a Questacon Membership.

Tickets are non-refundable.

Valid for one entry per person, per attraction, and cannot be used at the same attraction by the same person more than once. All people included on the voucher must attend the same attraction at the same time.
